storyInfo: Driven to madness by avarice, the Dublinners are led into the Dark Woods by the greedy red dragon. From the grain shop owner, Loughshinny and Brigid learn the truth about Theo's disappearance and the whereabouts of the smuggled food carts.

attributes.content: A beetle flies through the dark alley.
It flaps its wings furiously, but only manages to find its way into an abandoned block that few souls tread anymore.
Its golden body is too heavy, weighed down even further by the gems on its wings. It can only fly a short distance before coming to a rest in a gap between the stone tiles—
Found you!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: I got it! I got it!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: You've got your bug, now help me get these crystals before they fall into the ditch!
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: Coming—
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Hold on, I am going to get my cut if I help you, right?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Sure, sure! Just hurry! You don't want to see these crystals end up in the ditch, do you?
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: Sweet cloudbeast, you're mine!
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Good... all the gems on the sword are there...
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: Where are The Brigadier and the others?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Who cares?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: The Bureaucrat tucks away the parasite, while The Officer eagerly watches the crystal tears drop again and again.
The Ombudsman brusquely manhandles the cloudbeast, while The Torturer raises the sword as though it conferred power over life and death.
What a lively scene.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: All of this treasure is yours, my servants.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I am not so miserly as to withhold them after seeing how much you love them.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But what more do you intend to take from me, once I have given you these?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Let me guess...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A path appears at the dead end of the alley, and even more shiny baubles rush towards it.
There is no time to bother with what is already in their hands.
They scramble for the treasure on the ground, stuffing it into their pockets, carrying it on their backs, and rushing towards the next shiny piece before even standing back up from the last one.
None of them care where the path leads.
...going to Dossoles tomorrow... It's high time I treated myself to something nice...
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: ...squeeze these country bumpkins in Na Saoirsí a little more...
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: ...don't forget my share...
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: ...can't wait for the townsfolk to send me some 'Victorian spies'...
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: My, my. After far more than just wealth, aren't we?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A life of luxury. A high status. Power over life and death. You want it all.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I have nothing against being true to your desires. And what you desire are things that I will not miss.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Unfortunately, you happen to be my servants, yet you seem far greedier than I.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So goodbye. Go to where you belong.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The treasures pave a shiny path where none existed, sending the madmen out of the Lair and out onto the land...
Towards whence the darkness came, the gaping mouth of the Dark Woods.
...This part is very different from the rest of your work.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I told you, I've abandoned many drafts in the process of observing, thinking, and writing. Any and all of them ready to be thrown in at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Do you really think I'd be sitting here, drinking this swill, if I could tell this story as a consistent, unified narrative?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: You're the one insisting it gets a proper ending, not me.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: True.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: But if I must regard this passage as your own personal embellishment, should I also consider the rejection of Brigid by the mist to be a creative liberty as well?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: ...No more than the Exiled King you forced into the story.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Then what about the rest of the story you are about to tell? Should it be seen as an observation, or as a creation?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: That's up to you to decide. Do you want me to tell it or not?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Of course, of course. Go on...
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: So what was wrong with Emma?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Just a cold, on top of mild malnutrition.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She didn't look so bad on the outskirts of the Dark Woods.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...A sickness of the spirit, most likely.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Iron for the statue needed to be collected from door to door. People won't even turn on their lamps to save fuel, never mind food...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What could she possibly be shipping out?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She runs a grain store. Maybe...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But only a grain store. She couldn't have done this on her own. There must be somebody behind her.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: We also still need to ask about Theo. There's no time to wait for her to come to on her own.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ugh—agh!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Can you hear me, Emma?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ni—Niels!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Take me with you... take me with you!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: No, she's still dreaming.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Niels... is that somebody's name?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I've seen it written on letters she's gotten. A loved one, if I had to guess.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And where might we find them?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No idea. It's been a while since the last letter.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Niels...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Scold me, beat me if you must... but don't abandon me...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: The Bureaucrat told me to smuggle food, so I did... What meaning is there in a life without you? What point is there in being kind to others?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: The Bureaucrat... Dublinn.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: There's so much food in the city. A single cart won't make a difference...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: There's no food in the city. A single cart won't make a difference...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Won't make a difference...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Should we keep trying to wake her up?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Why wasn't it you who lived?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Those accursed Victorians... Why did their child live?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: A child... of Victorians?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Ugh... uh...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: It'll be alright, my dear—I'll make things right—
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Wait for me, Niels... Wait for me, my love...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: I can't see you, my love! I can't see you...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Why? Why?!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: The Victorians who killed you have been chased out!
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: The last Victorian bastard died... before my eyes...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Niels...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Sweat fills Emma's fevered brow. Tormented by nightmares, she instinctively grabs the sheets beneath her, but it does not stop her from trembling.
The other two stand up at the same time.
It's already past curfew. Will we really able to move freely?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Stick with me. If the mist wants to take either of us, let it try.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Wait, someone's coming over from the citadel!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Looks like Dublinn. It's...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The Brigadier!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What's going on? It's like he's a walking ghost...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Brigadier!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Loughshinny?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Go back, now, back to...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Nothing happened tonight.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: We have a lead on the food shortage, sir.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The owner of this grain store was instructed by The Bureaucrat to smuggle food out of Na Saoirsí. We may be able to get it back, if we're quick.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The Bureaucrat? I should have known—
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: But it's too late. Everything's too late.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Why? Do you know where the food went?
attributes.name: Loughshinny
The Brigadier
attributes.content: Not the food...

attributes.name: The Brigadier
attributes.content: Me. Us.
Thank you for informing me, but I...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: What is going on? Tell me!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, nothing happened tonight.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: I can't imagine what could have turned you... a warrior with no qualms about killing for the greater good, into... this.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Did you and Dublinn found this nation over the corpses of so many, just to starve your own people to death here?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No. Never.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Thank you for informing me. I will... deal with it, personally.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: But do not mention the name Dublinn ever again.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: You got your promise. Do not set foot on the streets again tonight, and especially do not break curfew with someone insignificant, as you're doing now.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: This is for your own good.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Loughshinny opens her mouth to speak, but The Brigadier shows no acknowledgment.
He turns around and walks towards the outskirts of the city with heavy, dragging steps.
Are we gonna do as he says? Hide?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...No, Nemos needs to know about Theo. Do you know where she lives?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It's a wee bit far, practically the other side of Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Then that's where we're going.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Nemos's house is just ahead.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: That was easy. Seems the mist didn't get into the city tonight.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Nemos? Are you home?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Nemos?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hey, didn't she say she'd be at the Dublinn victory party? Is she not back yet?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The Brigadier was leaving the citadel. The party should be over.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Miss Loughshinny... Brigid?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Loughshinny is about to speak when her gaze meets Nemos's.
Her eyes are even blanker than the Brigadier's were.
What's going on? Did something happen at the victory party?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, nothing happened tonight...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: What are you two doing here?!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Quick, inside! You mustn't be out on the streets tonight!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: As Nemos hurries Loughshinny and Brigid inside, The Brigadier passes beyond the boundaries of Na Saoirsí.
He walks into the forest, where there is nothing but darkness, towards the depths of the dark mist.
Then, the food carts that had been smuggled out of Na Saoirsí slowly emerge from it.
They will return to Na Saoirsí's agricultural plate before dawn.
The next day, the city gets the smallest of reprieves from the food shortage. No one notices that The Brigadier never returned from the Dark Woods.
The food mysteriously appear at the agricultural plate before making its way to the grain stores across the city. It falls well short of truly solving the problem.
But it was far more than just The Brigadier who never came back, though the people of the city do not know it yet.
Once again the sun rises, without pity or care.
The dragon and the wayward wakewoman walk the streets, watching with shock at how the now-commonplace brawls descend into even more brutal violence.
The nomad knocks on the blacksmith's door. She brings woeful news.
